meanings.definition: A person who is drunk or intoxicated.
meanings.sent1: After too many drinks, the shicker stumbled out of the bar.
meanings.sent2: The party was full of shickers dancing and laughing.
meanings.sent3: The shicker tried to order more drinks but couldn't pronounce the words correctly.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with shickers, their laughter echoing in the night.
meanings.sent5: The shicker's face was flushed, and their words slurred as they spoke.

meanings.sent1: He tends to shicker at every celebration, unable to control his alcohol intake.
meanings.sent2: The group decided to shicker together to celebrate their success.
meanings.sent3: She shickered at the party and ended up telling embarrassing stories to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The room started to spin as he began to shicker from the strong cocktails.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of alcohol filled the air as they continued to shicker throughout the night.
